column1: Lukhovitsy (Russian: Лухови́цы) is a town and the administrative center of Lukhovitsky District in Moscow Oblast
column3: located on the Oka River 135 kilometers (84 mi) southeast of Moscow. Population: 29

column1: It was first mentioned in 1594 as the settlement of Glukhovichi (Глуховичи)
column2: a votchina of a Ryazan archbishop. It used to be called Lukhovichi (Луховичи) until the mid-1920s. In 1957
column3: it was granted town status. The town grew rapidly after the transfer of testing (and later production) facilities of the Mikoyan design bureau.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Lukhovitsy serves as the administrative center of Lukhovitsky District. As an administrative division
column4: together with the settlement of stantsii Chernaya
column5: incorporated within Lukhovitsky District as the Town of Lukhovitsy. As a municipal division
column6: the Town of Lukhovitsy is incorporated within Lukhovitsky Municipal District as Lukhovitsy Urban Settlement.

column1: The town is served by the Tretyakovo Airport. A bus terminal is located here.
Lukhovitsy is famous for growing cucumbers; there is a monument of a cucumber in the town.
Губернатор Московской области. Постановление №123-ПГ от 28 сентября 2010 г. «Об учётных данных административно-территориальных и территориальных единиц Московской области»
column2: в ред. Постановления №252-ПГ от 26 июня 2015 г. «О внесении изменения в учётные данные административно-территориальных и территориальных единиц Московской области».  Опубликован: "Информационный вестник Правительства МО"
column4: 30 октября 2010 г. (Governor of Moscow Oblast. Resolution #123-PG of September 28

column6: as amended by the Resolution #252-PG of June 26
column7: 2015 On Amending the Inventory Data of the Administrative-Territorial and Territorial Units of Moscow Oblast. ).
